front.title: A Method for Registering Internationalized Domain Names

abstract.t: This document describes some suggested practices for registeringinternationalized domain names (IDNs) in a zone. Before acceptingregistrations of domain names into a zone, the zone's registry shoulddecide which codepoints in the Unicode character set the zone willaccept. The registry should also decide whether particular characters ina registered domain name should cause registration of multipleequivalent domain names; these domain names might be added to the zoneor blocked from registration. This document also describes how to handlecharacter variants in registering IDNs, and how to publish tables thatlist the character variants.
